bug.short_desc: "&" and "<" (perhaps others) get swapped with the space before them in a reply.

assigned_to.name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

long_desc.thetext:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; en-US; rv:1.9.2.15) Gecko/20110303 Firefox/3.6.3 GIT Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; en-US; rv:1.9.2.15) Gecko/20110303 Thunderbird/3.1.9
when i respond to a message that has a sentence (fragment) such as "> stuff & then proceeded", the text gets altered to ">> stuff& then proceeded". note the ampersand ends up attached to the end of the prior word & an extra space inserted after it.
this happens on both windows & mac osx & has been occurring for most of the 3.x release. looks really weird not to mention undesirable.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. respond to an email with eg: "text & more text" 2. 3. Actual Results: in the reply, the text is altered to ">text& text"
note this occurs when using plain text email. not noticed if it also happens with html mail because i avoid html mail.
Expected Results: thunderbird should not rewrite the content beyond adding the ">" indicating the source of the text.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 448198 ***
